qas.question: Along where do many birds migrate?
What is the most common pattern of migration in the spring?
What is the most common directionof migration in autumn?
Why do the birds fly north?

context: Many bird populations migrate long distances along <a0_0>a flyway<a0_0/>. The most common pattern involves <a1_0>flying north<a1_0/> in the spring <a3_0>to breed<a3_0/> in the temperate or Arctic summer and returning in the autumn to wintering grounds in warmer regions to the <a2_0>south<a2_0/>. Of course, in the southern hemisphere the directions are reversed, but there is less land area in the far south to support long-distance migration.
